DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Colostomy Or Ileostomy Performed Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to whether an operative procedure of a colostomy or an ileostomy was completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Colostomy Or Ileostomy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to whether an operative procedure of a colostomy or an ileostomy was completed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ko-LAHS-toe-mee) An opening into the colon from the outside of the body. A colostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the colon has been removed.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:(il-ee-AHS-toe-mee) An opening into the ileum, part of the small intestine, from the outside of the body. An ileostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the intestine has been removed.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The surgical creation of an opening between the colon and the surface of the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Surgical creation of an external opening into the ileum for fecal diversion or drainage. Loop or tube procedures are most often employed.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.
